question: semantics

ans.value: not clear in meaning; not thinking or expressing your thoughts clearly or precisely;
the meaning and interpretation of words, signs and sentence structure.
to make (someone) do something by using force or threats
a situation in which many people behave or react in an extreme or uncontrolled way because of fear, anger, etc.

examples: The whole controversy is a matter of semantics. [=the controversy was caused by people understanding the same words in different ways]

question: guzzle

ans.value: As person who doesn't believe in god.
to drink quickly, eagerly, and usually in large amounts
to make (someone) do something by using force or threats
very harsh and critical

examples: He guzzled his beer and ordered another.
Telecom business is a money guzzler.

question: snuggle

ans.value: a tall, thick stone or dirt wall that is built around a castle, town, etc., to protect it from attacks
to lie or sit close together in a comfortable position
to support, strengthen, or defend (something)
As person who doesn't believe in god.

examples: The puppy snuggled up against the sleeping boy.
The boy snuggled close to his mother.

question: vague

a situation in which many people behave or react in an extreme or uncontrolled way because of fear, anger, etc.
to make (someone) do something by using force or threats
not clear in meaning; not thinking or expressing your thoughts clearly or precisely;

examples: The instructions she left were vague and difficult to follow.

The judges determined that the law was too vague to be fairly enforced.
